basics.name: Lorène Jeantet
basics.label: Computer Scientist for Wildlife Monitoring
basics.summary: I am a data scientist with a broad interest in remote monitoring of wildlife (acoustic, imaging, accelerometer). Specialized in signal processing, I developed a method to automatically identify behavior of sea turtle from bio-loggers based on deep learning. I am convinced that mathematics and new technologies are valuable tools to improve our knowledge on biodiversity and thus better protect it.

work.name: African Institute for Mathematical Sciences - AIMS South Africa
work.position: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Machine Learning for Ecology
work.summary: My research focuses on developing user-friendly tools powered by deep learning, with the primary goal of supporting wildlife monitoring and streamlining data processing in ecological research

education.institution: DEPE‑IPHC ‑ Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique
education.title: Title : Automatic identification of behaviors from bio-loggers: a solution to improve knowledge on sea turtle ecology?

education.institution: Ecole Nationale Supérieure Agronomique de Toulouse

awards.title: Thesis Prize Prix Albert Schweitzer
awards.summary: As part of its policy to support academic research, the CHAPITRE de SAINT-THOMAS established university awards in 2005.

awards.title: For Women In Science - French Young Talents
awards.summary: Every year, the French Young Talents program awards 35 talented women scientists at PhD and post-doctoral levels.

research.project: Reticulum-mitochondria interactions of pancreatic beta cells subjected to metabolic disturbances of diabetic pathologies
research.lab: Laboratoire CarMeN, UMR INSERM U1060/INRAE U1397

research.project: Automatic identification of behaviors of captive sea turtles from accelerometric data
